sections.renderMarkup: Anchor text

sections.description:
Default definition list style

  • definition lists have a bottom margin to separate them from each other
  • The last-child doesn't have this bottom margin so parent containers can have four-sided paddings
sections.renderMarkup:
<dl>
    <dt>Name</dt>
    <dd>attachments</dd>
    <dt>Dimensions</dt>
    <dd>908 x 655</dd>
    <dt>Size</dt>
    <dd>66.60 KB</dd>
</dl>

sections.description:
Default fieldset style

  • Fieldsets have a bottom margin to separate them from each other
  • The last-child doesn't have this bottom margin so parent containers can have four-sided paddings
sections.renderMarkup:
<fieldset>
    {content}
</fieldset>

sections.description:
Default image style

  • Images have a max-width to fit nicely into responsive layout
  • When image is the only child in a parent, vertical-align: middle is applied to eliminate line-height bug

sections.renderMarkup: <label>Label</label>

sections.description:
Default legend style

  • Legends have a bottom margin to separate them from each other
  • The last-child doesn't have this bottom margin so parent containers can have four-sided paddings
sections.renderMarkup:
<fieldset>
    <legend>
    {content}
</legend>
</fieldset>

sections.description:
Default paragraph style

  • Paragraphs have a bottom margin to separate them from each other
  • The last-child doesn't have this bottom margin so parent containers can have four-sided paddings

Open modal

• {content}
  • {content}

sections.description:
CSS only animated option list

  • Use for several options

A boolean list should only be used for true / false, 0 / 1, yes / no questions

  • Need more options? Use an option list instead
  • Booleanlist has a CSS only sliding animation. Option lists don't since it's not possible with CSS only

modifiers.name: default
.k-booleanlist--neutral

sections.description: Just add the class k-js-select2 to any <select> element to transform it into a select2 element
sections.renderMarkup:
<select class="k-form-control k-js-select2">
    <option value="1">Example 1</option>
    <option value="2">Example 2</option>
    <option value="3">Example 3</option>
</select>

sections.description:
The default sidebar item

  • Adds bottom spacing when multiple sidebar items are being used
  • Adds flexbox styling
  • Add .k-sidebar-item--flex to the sidebar items that need to grow with the layout
  • Add .k-sidebar-item--overflow to the sidebar items that need to shrink and overflow it's contents
  • Use only inside a .k-sidebar
  • {unsureText}

modifiers.name: .k-sidebar-item--flex
modifiers.description: Flexing container that will grow (and not shrink)

modifiers.name: .k-sidebar-item--overflow
modifiers.description: Flexing container that will shrink (and not grow) and overflow it's content

modifiers.name: .k-sidebar-item--toggle
modifiers.description: Adds a toggle button on certain screen sizes

sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
The default sidebar item header

  • Use only inside a .k-sidebar-item

sections.description:
The default titlebar

  • A titlebar that can be displayed above the content-wrapper when there's no toolbar
  • Very useful inside modal views
  • Always have at least a k-titlebar or a k-toolbar when there's a k-sidebar in your page!
  • Use as first child of the .k-wrapper only
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup: {Title}

sections.description:
Title just for mobile

  • Use never together with a .k-title-bar
  • Use only as child of .k-content
  • Only visible on smaller screens
  • {unsureText}

sections.description:
Elements that make up the structure of each page
You can see these layout elements as the default main grid

This is the most outer container of each page.

  • A .koowa-container may only live once on the page and should be handled as an id
  • Need to namespace something outside this container? Use the .koowa class
  • The koowa class should always be added to the koowa-container element for namespacing purposes
sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
The default wrapper

  • Use as child of the .koowa-container container only
  • Can be preceded by a .k-masthead
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
The default content-wrapper

  • Use as child of the .k-wrapper container only
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
Left and right sidebars

  • Use .k-sidebar-left as first child of the .k-content-wrapper container only
  • Use .k-sidebar-right as last child of the .k-content-wrapper container only
  • Make sure you Always have a .k-content container when a sidebar is used
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
The content container

  • Use as child of the .k-content-wrapper container only
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
The component container

  • Use as child of the .k-content container only
  • Can be preceded by a .k-title-bar.k-title-bar--mobile or a .k-toolbar
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup: ...

sections.description:
Fluid grid system

  • Has full, main and sub containers
  • Main and sub float next to each other
  • Main should always come first since the info is more important
  • {unsureText}
sections.renderMarkup:
...
...
...

sections.description:
A flex wrapper that can be used on elements that need flexbox

  • Only use this class on containers that only contain one child
  • This is a shrink and grow container

modifiers.name: .k-table-data--nowrap
modifiers.description: Content will not be wrapped (useful for dates, file sizes etc.)

modifiers.name: .k-table-data--wrap
modifiers.description: Wrap long content (useful for urls etc.)

modifiers.name: .k-table-data--toggle
modifiers.description: The cell that will have a responsive toggle button

modifiers.name: .k-table-data--ellipsis
modifiers.description: Break content at the end of the cell and add text ellipsis

section.description:
The default titlebar

  • A titlebar that can be displayed above the content-wrapper when there's no toolbar
  • Very useful inside modal views
  • Always have at least a k-titlebar or a k-toolbar when there's a k-sidebar in your page!
  • Use as first child of the .k-wrapper only
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup: {Title}

section.description:
Title just for mobile

  • Use never together with a .k-title-bar
  • Use only as child of .k-content
  • Only visible on smaller screens
  • {unsureText}

section.description:
Elements that make up the structure of each page
You can see these layout elements as the default main grid

This is the most outer container of each page.

  • A .koowa-container may only live once on the page and should be handled as an id
  • Need to namespace something outside this container? Use the .koowa class
  • The koowa class should always be added to the koowa-container element for namespacing purposes
section.renderMarkup: ...

section.description:
The default wrapper

  • Use as child of the .koowa-container container only
  • Can be preceded by a .k-masthead
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup: ...

section.description:
The default content-wrapper

  • Use as child of the .k-wrapper container only
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup: ...

section.description:
Left and right sidebars

  • Use .k-sidebar-left as first child of the .k-content-wrapper container only
  • Use .k-sidebar-right as last child of the .k-content-wrapper container only
  • Make sure you Always have a .k-content container when a sidebar is used
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup: ...

section.description:
The content container

  • Use as child of the .k-content-wrapper container only
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup: ...

section.description:
The component container

  • Use as child of the .k-content container only
  • Can be preceded by a .k-title-bar.k-title-bar--mobile or a .k-toolbar
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup: ...

section.description:
Fluid grid system

  • Has full, main and sub containers
  • Main and sub float next to each other
  • Main should always come first since the info is more important
  • {unsureText}
section.renderMarkup:
...
...
...

section.description:
A flex wrapper that can be used on elements that need flexbox

  • Only use this class on containers that only contain one child
  • This is a shrink and grow container
section.renderMarkup: ...
